column4: could be several reasons, but most likely is some package necessary to complete the upgrade isn't available
you can do   sudo apt-get dist-upgrade --dry-run   to see what might be necessary. No changes will be made to your system.
/var/www

it gets reset by udev on boot, why do you want to change the permissions on it from the default?
as i want to give w/r to all
add what ever user you want to use the ttyS0 to the dialout group
how can i add root?
via shell

root owns it, has write permissions. To add some other user, do   sudo adduser <user> dialout .  Any user you add to a group is required to log out completely and then log back in for the group change to take effect
